activities.message:
Hi @e333jsjs7se, 

Thank you for your submission! Getting badges information of any user including disabled user doesn't post any security risk and we are fine with current behavior, hence closing this submission as Informative.

Regards.

Hi @chessmast3r 
seems reasonable if we reveal this to the public because my signal becomes bad because of this? what do you think?

**This behavior shows because the number of users who perform the user disabled action for not to be seen again. then why is this seen?**

and in **HackerOne** ```filter hacktivity``` only exists
1. Disclosed
2. Bounty Bug
3. All


Then why does this only show ```From:/UserName``` only ????

*Best Regards,*

Hi @e333jsjs7se - thanks for following up, but this is something we're fine with. These badges don't pose a security risk. We're not going to do anything here. Regarding the filter: we use that one for the Hacktivity feed on the user's profile. The reports remain accessible, which is why the Hacktivity feed can still be queried. The fact that we don't expose that in the UI doesn't mean that it's a security vulnerability. Thanks again and happy hacking!

Hi @jobert 
but there is something that confuses me, even when the user is disabled.
the user's profile page can not be opened, then the reputation and rank become blank not visible. and then why not everything in full?

Then what is the use of disabled feature (Disable Account)? 
and also I know if this does not become sensitive information but does not hackerone attach importance to the customer (Research)??
Because with the behavior as above I think there is no benefit to perform the feature Disable account.

Thanks you again.

It serves multiple purposes, but the most important ones are that we don't accidentally send invites to them and that we have the ability to block users on the platform, not to hide their data on hackerone.com. We might change this again in the future, but it's not something we're going to spend any time on soon.

Hi @jobert 
hahaha, yes it seems fair if this became my first public disclosure in *HackerOne,* what do you think?

Hi @e333jsjs7se - my bad, I missed your disclosure request. We're fine disclosing this. Again, we may change this behavior in the future but decided not to prioritize a fix for this at this point. Until then, we'll keep this closed as informative. Thanks again for your report and we look forward to receive more reports from you in the future. Happy hacking!
